comment: xsec for H125 samples is taken from this ad interim prescription: https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/LHCPhysics/LHCHWG136TeVxsec_extrap

for the other mass points the xsec is scaled from 13 TeV to 13.6 TeV following this prescription: xsec_13p6 = xsec_13 * 0.4 + xsec_14 * 0.6 https://indico.cern.ch/event/1169286/contributions/5126668/attachments/2557560/4416316/HXSWG.pdf#page=5
signal BR values taken from YR4 https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/LHCPhysics/CERNYellowReportPageBR

for ZH and ttH the BR is obtained as BR(H->ZZ->2L2X) = BR(H->4L) + BR(H->2L2q) + BR(H->ZZ*->2L2nu) * BR(H->2L2nu) / [ BR(H->ZZ*->2L2nu) + BR(H->WW*->2L2nu) ] where BR(H->4L) BR(H->2L2q) and BR(H->2L2nu) are taken from the YR4 twiki
for ZH the BR column will include also the gen filter efficiency (under computation)
These samples correspond to the E-F-G data taking periods - after the ECAL leak (called Run3EE)
qq->ZZ signal - xsec taken from powheg gridpack
column13: BR = (n_lep)^2*BR(Z-->2l)^2 w/ n_lep = 3 and BR(Z-->2l) from the PDG https://pdg.lbl.gov/2023/tables/contents_tables.html

identifier: # WE SHOULD ACTUALLY BE USING VVZJets SAMPLES AS THE TRIBOSON BACKGROUND

comment: xsec at 13 TeV ACTUALLY < 0.2 JUST CHOSE 0.15
